abstract: Election cycle for 2016 presidential race has few limits on contributions to 'super PACs,' or from other outside groups able to make substantial campaign donations; difference between 2016 race and previous election cycles is that wealthy donors are no longer satisfied to just write checks, but are getting involved directly in campaign efforts; candidates and super PACs themselves are being inundated with suggestions, questions and even demands from some of their high-rolling donors.
lead_paragraph: Contributors suggest strategies and expect their views to receive quick attention, occasionally creating headaches for the campaigns.

headline.main: Big Donors Seek Larger Roles in Presidential Campaigns
headline.print_headline: Big Donors Increasingly Give Campaigns Not Just Checks but Also Their 2 Cents

snippet: Contributors suggest strategies and expect their views to receive quick attention, occasionally creating headaches for the campaigns.
